example.title: Examples
example.p: This section contains examples of how the simpletable element can be used.

image.alt: The image shows a two-column table. The first column lists menu items, and the second column lists price. The header row is shaded with green, and the text in the header row is bold. The edges of the screen capture are tattered, to indicate that the image is part of a larger document.

fig.title: Example of a simple table with column and row spanning
fig.p: The following code sample shows a simple table that tracks meals. It has a title and column and row spans.
fig.codeblock: <simpletable> <title>Food log for Wednesday</title> <sthead> <stentry>Meal</stentry> <stentry>Food</stentry> </sthead> <strow> <stentry colspan="2">Fasting period</stentry> </strow> <strow> <stentry>Lunch</stentry> <stentry rowspan="2">Pasta</stentry> </strow> <strow> <stentry>Dinner</stentry> </strow> </simpletable>
fig.p: The simple table might be rendered as follows:

image.alt: The image shows a two-column table. The first column lists the meal, and the second column lists food eaten. The first row contains the text "Fasting period," and it spans two columns. The next two rows are for "Lunch" and "Dinner". The second cell in both rows contains the text "Pasta," and it spans two rows. The header row is shaded with green, and the text in the header row is bold. The edges of the screen capture are tattered, to indicate that the image is part of a larger document.

fig.title: Example of a simple table that uses keycol
fig.p: The following code sample shows a simple table that contains information about menu items: calories and price. The keycol attribute indicates that the first column, which contains the menu items, is the key column.

example.p: This simple table might be rendered as follows:

image.alt: The image shows a three-column table. The first column lists menu items, the second column lists calories, and the third column lists price. The header row is shaded with green, and the text in the header row is bold. In addition, the contents of the first column are highlighted in bold, to indicate that the first column serves as a vertical header. The edges of the screen capture are tattered, to indicate that the image is part of a larger document.

example.p: In the above sample rendering, the content of the key column is bolded. However, note that rendering of the key column is left up to the implementation.
